name: Tetsuo Mori
real_text:
Tetsuo Mori may be assigned damage and/or horror dealt to other investigators at your location.
[reaction] When Tetsuo Mori is defeated: Choose an investigator at your location. That investigator searches either their discard pile or the top 9 cards of their deck for an [[Item]] asset and adds it to their hand. Shuffle their deck if it is searched.
subname: Too Noble for His Own Good
text:
Tetsuo Mori may be assigned damage and/or horror dealt to other investigators at your location.
[reaction] When Tetsuo Mori is defeated: Choose an investigator at your location. That investigator searches either their discard pile or the top 9 cards of their deck for an [[Item]] asset and adds it to their hand. Shuffle their deck if it is searched.

name: "Fool me once..."
real_text:
Fast. Play when you would discard a treachery card after resolving any of its effects.
Put "Fool me once..." into play in your play area and attach that treachery to it.
[reaction] When any investigator draws a copy of the attached treachery card, discard "Fool me once...": Cancel that card's revelation effect.
text:
Fast. Play when you would discard a treachery card after resolving any of its effects.
Put "Fool me once..." into play in your play area and attach that treachery to it.
[reaction] When any investigator draws a copy of the attached treachery card, discard "Fool me once...": Cancel that card's revelation effect.

name: Self-Sacrifice
real_text:
Commit only to a skill test (of any type) being performed by another investigator at your location.
If this test fails, you must resolve all effects from the failed test, instead of the performing investigator. Then, either you draw 2 cards, or the performing investigator draws 2 cards.
text:
Commit only to a skill test (of any type) being performed by another investigator at your location.
If this test fails, you must resolve all effects from the failed test, instead of the performing investigator. Then, either you draw 2 cards, or the performing investigator draws 2 cards.

name: Otherworld Codex
real_text:
Uses (3 secrets).
[action] Exhaust Otherworld Codex and spend 1 secret: Search the top 9 cards of the encounter deck and choose a non-[[Elite]] card among them. Discard a copy of the chosen card from play. Shuffle all of the searched cards back into the encounter deck.
text:
Uses (3 secrets).
[action] Exhaust Otherworld Codex and spend 1 secret: Search the top 9 cards of the encounter deck and choose a non-[[Elite]] card among them. Discard a copy of the chosen card from play. Shuffle all of the searched cards back into the encounter deck.

name: Dream-Enhancing Serum
real_text:
Only the first copy of each card in your hand counts toward your maximum hand size.
[reaction] After you draw a copy of a card that is already in your hand, reveal both copies and exhaust Dream-Enhancing Serum: Draw 1 card.
text:
Only the first copy of each card in your hand counts toward your maximum hand size.
[reaction] After you draw a copy of a card that is already in your hand, reveal both copies and exhaust Dream-Enhancing Serum: Draw 1 card.

name: "Let God sort them out..."
real_text:
Play only during one of your turns in which you defeated enemies with a total of 6 or more health.
Add "Let God sort them out..." to the victory display and immediately end your turn. When earning experience during the resolution of this scenario, you earn 1 additional experience.
text:
Play only during one of your turns in which you defeated enemies with a total of 6 or more health.
Add "Let God sort them out..." to the victory display and immediately end your turn. When earning experience during the resolution of this scenario, you earn 1 additional experience.

name: Swift Reload
real_text:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Choose a [[Firearm]] asset you control with fewer ammo tokens than its uses (X) value. Place ammo on that asset until it has ammo equal to its uses (X) value.
text:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Choose a [[Firearm]] asset you control with fewer ammo tokens than its uses (X) value. Place ammo on that asset until it has ammo equal to its uses (X) value.

flavor: Long before he was ever dealt his first hand, the boy was able to stare a man down and discern the meaning behind his bets.
name: Gregory Gry
real_text:
Uses (9 resources).
[reaction] When you initiate a skill test, spend up to 3 resources from Gregory Gry: If this skill test succeeds by at least that amount, gain that many resources.
text:
Uses (9 resources).
[reaction] When you initiate a skill test, spend up to 3 resources from Gregory Gry: If this skill test succeeds by at least that amount, gain that many resources.

flavor: You don't necessarily trust the occult words, but you have no other choice.
name: Healing Words
real_text:
Uses (3 charges).
[action] Spend 1 charge: Heal 1 damage from an investigator at your location.
text:
Uses (3 charges).
[action] Spend 1 charge: Heal 1 damage from an investigator at your location.

name: Ethereal Form
real_text: Evade. Add your [willpower] value to your skill value for this evasion attempt. If you succeed, disengage from each other enemy engaged with you, and for the remainder of the round, you are ethereal (enemies cannot engage or be engaged with you, and you cannot attack or deal damage to enemies).
text: Evade. Add your [willpower] value to your skill value for this evasion attempt. If you succeed, disengage from each other enemy engaged with you, and for the remainder of the round, you are ethereal (enemies cannot engage or be engaged with you, and you cannot attack or deal damage to enemies).

flavor:
You pry it out of the corpse's hand.
It's not like he's going to complain.
name: Scrounge for Supplies
real_text: Choose a level 0 card in your discard pile. Add the chosen card to your hand.
text: Choose a level 0 card in your discard pile. Add the chosen card to your hand.

name: Brute Force
real_text:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
While Brute Force is committed during a basic fight action, it gains [combat][combat] and the text: "If this test is successful by 2 or more, this attack deals +2 damage."
text:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
While Brute Force is committed during a basic fight action, it gains [combat][combat] and the text: "If this test is successful by 2 or more, this attack deals +2 damage."

name: Versatile
real_text:
Permanent.
You get +5 Deck Size.
Your investigator's Deckbuilding Options gain: "one other level 0 card from any class ([guardian], [seeker], [rogue], [mystic], or [survivor])."
text:
Permanent.
You get +5 Deck Size.
Your investigator's Deckbuilding Options gain: "one other level 0 card from any class ([guardian], [seeker], [rogue], [mystic], or [survivor])."

back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -2 (-4 instead if you are at a [[Graveyard]] location).
[cultist]: Reveal another token. If you fail and The Unnamable is in play, it attacks you (regardless of its current location).
[tablet]: +1. The black cat causes a distraction. If this test is successful, choose and evade an enemy at any location with a fight value of X or lower, where X is the amount you succeeded by.
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, you must either place 1 of your clues on your location or take 1 damage.
name: A Thousand Shapes of Horror

Easy / Standard
[skull]: -1 (-3 instead if you are at a [[Graveyard]] location).
[cultist]: Reveal another token. If you fail and The Unnamable is in play, it attacks you (regardless of its current location).
[tablet]: +2. The black cat causes a distraction. If this test is successful, choose and evade an enemy at any location with a fight value of X or lower, where X is the amount you succeeded by.
[elder_thing]: -2. If you fail, you must either place 1 of your clues on your location or take 1 damage.

Easy / Standard

flavor: The house that Randolph calls "The Unnamable" is not much to look at. The run-down seventeenth-century building has been abandoned for decades and has fallen into disrepair. Its door is scratched and pitted, most of the windowpanes are shattered, and rats crawl around the foundations.

linked_card.name: The Unnamable
linked_card.real_text: Spawn - Attic or Upstairs Hallway. Aloof. Hunter. Cannot be defeated. For each of the following which are true, The Unnamable gets -1 fight and -1 evade (the investigators "found a cracked mirror," "studied a desecrated portrait," or "noticed the missing bones").
linked_card.text:
Spawn - Attic or Upstairs Hallway.

Aloof. Hunter. Cannot be defeated.

For each of the following which are true, The Unnamable gets -1 fight and -1 evade (the investigators "found a cracked mirror," "studied a desecrated portrait," or "noticed the missing bones").

name: The House with No Name
The Unnamable
real_text: Spawn - Attic or Upstairs Hallway. Aloof. Hunter. Cannot be defeated. For each of the following which are true, The Unnamable gets -1 fight and -1 evade (the investigators "found a cracked mirror," "studied a desecrated portrait," or "noticed the missing bones").
text: Spawn - Attic or Upstairs Hallway. Aloof. Hunter. Cannot be defeated. For each of the following which are true, The Unnamable gets -1 fight and -1 evade (the investigators "found a cracked mirror," "studied a desecrated portrait," or "noticed the missing bones").

back_flavor: Time is running short. The entity, which before had seemed content to loom and observe you from afar, now swells with power and pursues you with relentless ferocity. It writhes and thrashes, seemingly everywhere at once. You have to hurry and confront your fears, or you will never find your way into the Dreamlands.
back_text: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.
flavor: You’ve felt an evil presence lurking here ever since you arrived. The entity defies all description. At times it appears formless; at others, it embodies myriad shapes and features. You can sometimes pick out a particular aspect - an eye, a horn, a blemish - but it disappears as soon as you focus on it.
name: The Thing with No Name
real_text: Each Swarm of Rats gains swarming 1. Forced - At the start of your turn, if The Unnamable is ready and at your location: Test [willpower] (2). If you fail, it attacks you (even if it is not engaged).
text: Each Swarm of Rats gains swarming 1. Forced - At the start of your turn, if The Unnamable is ready and at your location: Test [willpower] (2). If you fail, it attacks you (even if it is not engaged).

back_flavor:
To your surprise, the most dreadful sound - the one that will forever burn in your memory of the night's events - is not the echoing, despondent cries of the unnamable monstrosity or the papery crunch of dry corpses being devoured in the graveyard. It is the simple creaking of a lattice window.
Randolph turns rigid and pale. You realize the implication just after he recalls the sound. All of the window frames in the house had fallen long ago - all save for one. It was the attic window that kept hidden the accursed demonic darkness: the thing with no name. It reaches out for you.
flavor:
"There was a vortex of withering, ice-cold wind, and then the rattle of loose bricks and plaster; but I had mercifully fainted before I could learn what it meant."
 - H. P. Lovecraft, "The Unnamable"
name: The Dead with No Name
real_text: Each Swarm of Rats gains swarming 2. The Unnamable loses aloof and gains massive. Forced - At the start of your turn, if The Unnamable is ready and at your location: Test [willpower] (2). If you fail, it attacks you (even if it is not engaged).
text: Each Swarm of Rats gains swarming 2. The Unnamable loses aloof and gains massive. Forced - At the start of your turn, if The Unnamable is ready and at your location: Test [willpower] (2). If you fail, it attacks you (even if it is not engaged).

back_flavor: The tomb opens into a staircase that stretches deep underground before disappearing into darkness.
back_text: Set The Unnamable aside. It keeps all tokens and attachments. Remove each location from the game (or place it in the victory display if it has Victory X and no clues on it). Investigators are not defeated during this process. (Other enemies and attachments at those locations are discarded.) Shuffle the set-aside Mysterious Stairs locations and put 5 of them into play in a vertical line. Remove the remaining Mysterious Stairs location from the game. Place each investigator and the set-aside The Unnamable enemy at the topmost Mysterious Stairs location, revealing it. Search the encounter deck and discard pile for both copies of Locked Door and both copies of Secrets in the Attic, and remove them from the game. Shuffle each set-aside copy of Endless Descent into the encounter deck, along with the encounter discard pile.
flavor: You're still not sure exactly what you're meant to find inside the old house, but Randolph insists that you need to locate the "key." Seems like you have no choice but to search the house and see what you can turn up.
name: Searching the Unnamable
real_text: Objective - Explore the house to find a way into the Dreamlands. (Find and complete an objective on another scenario card to advance.)
text: Objective - Explore the house to find a way into the Dreamlands. (Find and complete an objective on another scenario card to advance.)

back_flavor:
The forlorn cries of the unnamable creature - whatever it is or once was - echo throughout the unnatural cavern from far above you. "It cannot reach us down here," Randolph says, letting out a sigh of relief. It was a harrowing descent, but you are finally safe from the indescribable thing. Even so, your safety is fleeting. The stairway coils below you with no end in sight. Windows in the spire's stone wall overlook an endless landscape of rocky crags and barren peaks, dimly lit by a grey phosphorous light. You are still many miles above the floor of this subterranean world, and who knows what horrors you may find once you arrive?
"This is only the beginning," Randolph warns you. "There is no turning back now. Are you ready to proceed?"
flavor: The steps seem to descend forever. Every time you think you're nearing the end, you round another corner and see hundreds more.
name: The Endless Stairs
real_text: While the bottommost Mysterious Stairs location is revealed, it gains: "[action]: Resign." Objective - Reach the bottom of the stairs. If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.
text: While the bottommost Mysterious Stairs location is revealed, it gains: "[action]: Resign." Objective - Reach the bottom of the stairs. If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.

back_flavor:
"Looking toward the giant willow in the centre of the cemetery, whose trunk has nearly engulfed an ancient, illegible slab, I had made a fantastic remark about the spectral and unmentionable nourishment which the colossal roots must be sucking in from that hoary, charnel earth...”
 - H. P. Lovecraft, "The Unnamable"
name: Burial Ground
real_text:
Each [[Ghoul]] enemy drawn spawns at Burial Ground instead of at its normal location.
[free] Investigators in the Burial Ground spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Remember that the investigators "noticed the missing bones."
text:
Each [[Ghoul]] enemy drawn spawns at Burial Ground instead of at its normal location.
[free] Investigators in the Burial Ground spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Remember that the investigators "noticed the missing bones."

back_flavor:
"I'd like to see that house, Carter. Where is it? Glass or no glass, I must explore it a little. And the tomb where you put those bones, and the other grave without an inscription - the whole thing must be a bit terrible.”
 - H. P. Lovecraft, "The Unnamable"
name: Entryway
real_text:
[free] Investigators in the Entryway spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Reveal the Upstairs Hallway.
[free] If The Unnamable has 1 [per_investigator] or more damage on it: Smoke trails off of the creature, leading to a tomb near the center of the cemetery outside. Put the set-aside Unmarked Tomb location into play.
text:
[free] Investigators in the Entryway spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Reveal the Upstairs Hallway.
[free] If The Unnamable has 1 [per_investigator] or more damage on it: Smoke trails off of the creature, leading to a tomb near the center of the cemetery outside. Put the set-aside Unmarked Tomb location into play.

back_flavor: This doorway was not open before. You only turned for a moment, but you thought you saw something. But what, exactly? A blur? A figure?
name: Den
real_text:
[reaction] After you successfully investigate the Den, discard 1 card from your hand: Discover an additional clue at this location.
[free] Investigators in the Den spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Remember that the investigators "studied a desecrated portrait."
text:
[reaction] After you successfully investigate the Den, discard 1 card from your hand: Discover an additional clue at this location.
[free] Investigators in the Den spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Remember that the investigators "studied a desecrated portrait."

back_flavor: This doorway was not open before. You only turned for a moment, but you thought you saw something. But what, exactly? A blur? A figure?
name: Parlor
real_text:
For each investigator at the Parlor, it gets +1 shroud.
[free] If The Unnamable has 2 [per_investigator] or more damage on it: The mirror gleams unnaturally, revealing a glint of silver. Remember that the investigators "recovered a strange key."
text:
For each investigator at the Parlor, it gets +1 shroud.
[free] If The Unnamable has 2 [per_investigator] or more damage on it: The mirror gleams unnaturally, revealing a glint of silver. Remember that the investigators "recovered a strange key."

back_flavor: "There! I was just trying to track my progress, and you can see it. Those little glints are eyes! They have to be! Something was watching me." - Annie VanderMeer Mitsoda, <u>The Investigators of Arkham Horror</u>
back_text: A malodorous presence prevents you from venturing upstairs. You cannot enter the Upstairs Hallway.
name: Upstairs Hallway
real_text: [free] Investigators in the Upstairs Hallway spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Put the set-aside Attic location into play.
text: [free] Investigators in the Upstairs Hallway spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Put the set-aside Attic location into play.

back_flavor: Something scratches at the wood on the other side. Rats? Your imagination? No, something else. Something unnatural.
name: Library
real_text:
As an additional cost to investigate the Library, you must either lose 1 action or take 1 horror.
[free] Investigators in the Library spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: You read a strange journal entry regarding one of the graves in the burial ground outside. Put the set-aside Unmarked Tomb location into play.
text:
As an additional cost to investigate the Library, you must either lose 1 action or take 1 horror.

back_flavor: Something scratches at the wood on the other side. Rats? Your imagination? No, something else. Something unnatural.
name: Bedroom
real_text:
[action] [action]: Discard all non-weakness treachery cards from your threat area.
[free] Investigators in the Bedroom spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Remember that the investigators "found a cracked mirror."
text:
[action] [action]: Discard all non-weakness treachery cards from your threat area.
[free] Investigators in the Bedroom spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Remember that the investigators "found a cracked mirror."

back_flavor:
"They never unlocked that attic door, but left the whole house as it was, dreaded and deserted. When noises came from it, they whispered and shivered; and hoped that the lock on that attic door was strong."
 - H. P. Lovecraft, "The Unnamable"
name: Attic
real_text: [free] Investigators in the Attic spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Deep within a pile of monstrous bones, you see a glint of silver. Remember that the investigators "recovered a strange key."
text: [free] Investigators in the Attic spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Deep within a pile of monstrous bones, you see a glint of silver. Remember that the investigators "recovered a strange key."

back_flavor:
"...from the tomb came such a stifled uproar of gasping and whirring that my fancy peopled the rayless gloom with Miltonic legions of the misshapen damned."
 - H. P. Lovecraft, "The Unnamable"
name: Unmarked Tomb
real_text: Objective - At the end of the round, if each undefeated investigator is at Unmarked Tomb and the investigators "recovered a strange key," advance the act.
text: Objective - At the end of the round, if each undefeated investigator is at Unmarked Tomb and the investigators "recovered a strange key," advance the act.

back_flavor:
"So worn and narrow were the steps, and so greasy with the ooze of inner earth, that the climber never quite knew when to expect a breathless fall and hurtling down to the ultimate pits..."
 - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dream-Quest of Unknown Kadath</u>
back_text: Mysterious Stairs is connected to the locations above and below it.

flavor:
"Inside, wrapped in a discoloured parchment, was a huge key of tarnished silver covered with cryptical arabesques; but of any legible explanation there was none."
 - H. P. Lovecraft, "The Silver Key"
name: The Silver Key
real_text: [reaction] When you would take horror, exhaust The Silver Key: Cancel 1 of that horror.
subname: Key to the Gate of Dreams
text: [reaction] When you would take horror, exhaust The Silver Key: Cancel 1 of that horror.

name: Endless Descent
real_text: Revelation - Move each investigator and enemy at the topmost location to the location below it. Flip the topmost location to its unrevealed side, discard all tokens and attachments from it, and place it below the bottommost location. Shuffle the positions of each unrevealed location so you cannot tell which is which. Add this card to the victory display.
text: Revelation - Move each investigator and enemy at the topmost location to the location below it. Flip the topmost location to its unrevealed side, discard all tokens and attachments from it, and place it below the bottommost location. Shuffle the positions of each unrevealed location so you cannot tell which is which. Add this card to the victory display.

name: Indescribable Apparition

name: Secrets in the Attic
real_text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, take 1 horror and put Secrets in the Attic into play next to the agenda deck. [free] abilities on locations cannot be triggered. Forced - At the end of the round: Discard 1 copy of Secrets in the Attic from play. (Max once per round.)
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, take 1 horror and put Secrets in the Attic into play next to the agenda deck. [free] abilities on locations cannot be triggered. Forced - At the end of the round: Discard 1 copy of Secrets in the Attic from play. (Max once per round.)
